page.title: 16DRUGS AND YOUTH.
page.content: Recently,{drug taking}in Netherley has become a serious problem. It is common because people are{unemployed} and bored and take drugs for something to do. They often stay in bed all day and then go and spend Â£2.50 upwards on drugs. It is easy to obtain a variety of drugs from{dealers}on the estate. Drug-takers get{addicted}and soon need more and more, so they often {steal}from shops, houses and cars to get money. Dealers on our estate will give drugs in exchange for possessions such as rings or watches.If you can't get money to pay them back you forfeit the item. There are{children}as young as{eight on drugs and although schools warn us of the dangers many ignore this and experiment by inhaling petrol fumes or glue to get high. The{worst drug}is heroin or 'smack',inhaled up the nose.
